items.content_html:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Safer Aurora and Legal Defense Fund Ordinances are items 13A and 13B coming up later in the agenda! But you can still call to get in line to speak!

How to participate:
Call (855) 695-3475 then *3
Call in to get in the queue, then the operator will tell you you’re in the queue. ...
Folks will be allowed to speak once Council gets to the agenda item.
Remember! They will only allow you to speak for 2 minutes.

See MoreColorado People's Alliance was live.

How to participate:
Call (855) 695-3475 then *3

Call in 30 mins before the meeting to get in the queue, then the operator will tell you you’re in the queue.

...

Folks will be allowed to speak once Council gets to the agenda item.

Remember! They will only allow you to speak for 2 minutes

Llame a la línea de comentarios públicos en vivo al 1-877-820-7831 y marque el codigo de participante 254610#

para comunicarse con el operador. El operador le preguntará sobre qué elemento le gustaría hablar la persona que llama y lo colocará en la linea para ese elemento. Nuestros elementos son 13a y 13b

La línea telefónica para comentarios públicos se abrirá a las 6:00 p.m. el día de la reunión del Consejo.

items.title: CALL TO ACTION FOR COLORADO PEOPLE’S ALLIANCE!!! WHY: Colorado...
items.content_html:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

CALL TO ACTION FOR COLORADO PEOPLE’S ALLIANCE!!!

WHY: Colorado People's Alliance (COPA) has been instrumental in fighting for progressive social change and racial justice locally and statewide.

WHAT: COPA’s current focus is on contacting Aurora City Council and encouraging them to support The Safer Aurora (13a) and Legal Defense Fund (13b) Ordinances. Aurora is the third largest and most diverse city in Colorado but many do not feel safe in Aurora. Black immigrants are mor...e likely to be criminalized by the policing system and are more likely to be denied bond or be deported at a higher rate than non-Black immigrants. Among other things, these ordinances would disable 287(g) contracts, which enable law enforcement to transfer immigrants they detain to ICE custody. These ordinances also offer Legal Defense Fund (13b) for those taken into custody to allow proper legal representation for those detained.

WHEN: Aurora City Council will meet to vote on these ordinances on Monday January 25 at 6:30 pm.

HOW TO HELP:
1.) Call the live public comment line at 6:00pm on Monday night and ask them to vote YES on the Safer Aurora Ordinance (13a) and Immigrant Legal Defense Fund Ordinance (13b): 855-695-3475 and press *3 for operator
To follow along with the proceedings and know exactly when the ordinances are coming up for discussion:
Join the COPA watch party - https://m.facebook.com/events/215981183457896
View the proceedings in real time - https://m.facebook.com/events/215981183457896
2.) Email or call Aurora City Council prior to Monday to express your support
Angela Lawson alawson@auroragov.org 720-244-6932
Curtis Gardner cgardner@auroragov.org 720-505-4312
Mike Coffman mcoffman@auroragov.org 303-739-7015

Want suggestions on what to say? See image below.

See More

items.title: Keep families together with solidarity meals! Carlos and...
items.content_html:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Keep families together with solidarity meals!

Carlos and Yessenia Martinez shared their family's story with the media today at great risk, let's show up and support them by buying pupusas this weekend.

You can order at https://solidaritymeals.paperform.co

...

#FamiliesBelongTogether

See MoreSanctuary4All Colorado is in Boulder, Colorado.

Yessenia and her husband Carlos have been advocating for immigrant rights in Denver for years and bravely sharing their family’s story. This weekend they’re sel...ling pupusas, which are incredibly popular in El Salvador, Carlos’ home country, and in Salvadoran & Honduran communities across the U.S. You can order at https://solidaritymeals.paperform.co

items.title: Welcome back Jeanette Vizguerra, a Mexican immigrant who has...
items.content_html:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Welcome back Jeanette Vizguerra, a Mexican immigrant who has fought for labor, civil, as well as human rights for 23 years, back to Denver. Jeanette returns from Delaware after leaving the safety of sanctuary to speak at the Biden transition headquarters to fight for all 11 million undocumented immigrants in the United States.

Jeanette has fought for immigrant rights and her own deportation case for more than a decade, and she took an enormous risk to her safety and risked t...he potential separation from her children to speak out - let's show her we will fight alongside her as she and other immigrant rights advocates put pressure on the Biden administration to find a permanent path to legal status for all undocumented immigrants in the U.S.

Let's show Jeanette we know that temporary relief like DACA, TPS, and other programs for immigrant and refugee communities are not enough.

That we are furious that families have been torn apart at our borders and within our communities, incarcerated unjustly and unnecessarily during a global pandemic.

That it is unacceptable that hundreds are, like Jeanette, Ingrid Latorre, Jorge Ávila, and so many others are living in sanctuary, fighting for a way to stay with their families in the United States.

That we will not stand for a broken asylum system.

#FreeThemAll #RestoringWelcome #DontLookAway #MigrantJustice #ImmigrantJustice

See More

TUE, JAN 19

Welcoming Jeanette

1400 N Lafayette St, Denver, CO 80218-2312, United States40 people interested

items.title: Yessenia is selling pupusas through Sanctuary4All Colorado for...
items.content_html:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Yessenia is selling pupusas through Sanctuary4All Colorado for pickup on the 23rd!

She’s a mom to two beautiful children and is fighting to keep her family together, along with all families impacted by the violent U.S. immigration system. One way you can support is by ordering her food & sharing her story. If you've ever ordered pupusas from her before, you know how good they are - she would love to open her own restaurant if given the chance, and it shows in her cooking!

Pic...kup in Denver & Boulder, 1/23, 1-3 PM.
Order at https://solidaritymeals.paperform.co.
Venmo: @yessenia-martinez-25
Menu:
-Frijol con queso pupusas $3 - thick flatbread made with masa and stuffed with beans and cheese. Served with curtido and salsa roja.
-Chicharron con queso pupusa $3 - thick flatbread made with masa and stuffed with chicharrones and cheese. Served with curtido and salsa roja.

items.title: Today, Martin Luther King Jr is revered as one of the most...
items.content_html:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Today, Martin Luther King Jr is revered as one of the most influential humans in history, but a poll taken in 1967 indicated that MLK Jr. was one of the most hated men in America, and 1/3 of Americans said he brought on his assassination in 1968. Leaving this type of information out of history books is very intentional. Remember him for who he truly was.

****
ID: tweet from Marc Lamont Hill that says “Today, let us remember Martin Luther King as he was: A Black radical anti-capitalist, anti-imperialist, revolutionary Christian who died as an enemy of the State. Anything else is just a lie.” Tweet is superimposed over a black and white photo of MLK raising his hand to a large crowd.

items.title: Jeanette Vizguerra has left the safety of sanctuary to travel to...
items.content_html:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Jeanette Vizguerra has left the safety of sanctuary to travel to Biden transition headquarters to demand the President-elect issue a moratorium to put an end to detention and deportations on Day 1. Undocumented folks are at President-elect Joe Biden’s transition HQ today to demand he prioritize undocumented people in his first 100 days, starting on day 1. No more broken promises. We need immediate executive action.

#MoratoriumDay1 Sanctuary4All Colorado Metro Denver Sanctuary Coalition Colorado Immigrant Rights Coalition - CIRC AFSC & Coloradans For Immigrant Rights

items.title: Immigration rights and immigration reform must be central to the...
items.content_html:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Immigration rights and immigration reform must be central to the incoming Biden administration. Temporary relief like DACA, TPS, and other programs for immigrant and refugee communities are not enough. Families are torn apart at our borders and within our communities, incarcerated unjustly and unnecessarily during a global pandemic. Hundreds are living in sanctuary, fighting for a way to stay with their families in the United States.

There are millions of immigrants and refugees living in the U.S. who have no path to legal status. Join AFSC & Coloradans For Immigrant Rights Sanctuary4All Colorado Colorado Immigrant Rights Coalition - CIRC Abolish ICE Denver and Metro Denver Sanctuary Coalition and impacted families to demand change!

#FreeThemAll

WED, JAN 13

Caravan for Immigration Reform

1200 Acoma St, Denver, CO 80204-3627, United StatesCauses · 235 people

items.title: Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ DenverBlack Lives Matter 5280**********ATTENTION: URGENT MATTER********** #WindsorGardensPhoneZap After...
items.content_html:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ DenverBlack Lives Matter 5280

**********ATTENTION: URGENT MATTER**********

#WindsorGardensPhoneZap
After community came for their necks just last week, Windsor Gardens is back at it with ano...ther member of their community battling racial injustice. Call and demand their Community Response team immediately stop all persecution of Sherry Dillahunty all day today 1/6/2021.

Ms. Dillahunty’s neighbors are weaponizing Community Response and Covenant Enforcement and the police against her and openly admit to it!

Call now and keep calling to let them know community is watching we will not stand by and watch as their tenants engage in racial terror against our elder!

Use this sample script:
“Hello, my name is _____ and I am calling to demand that the Community Response and Covenant Enforcement at Windsor Garden stop allowing racist neighbors to terrorize Sherry Dilahunty. Ms. Dillahunty has the right to move freely through her community and we will not stand for any further discrimination against her from Windsor Gardens. “

#BlackLivesMatter
#TheFightContinues
#TheTimeisNow
#ApplyPressure

[Image description: White and yellow words on a black background that reads, “CALL TO ACTION. Hashtag Windsor Gardens Phone Zap. CALL NOW! Director of Community Response and Convenant Enforcement: Chris Scovil. Phone: 303-364-7685 x1515. Email: cscovil@wgamail.com. Community Response Captain of Operations: Eddie Strock. Phone: 303-364-4924. Email: estrock@wgamail.com. The rest of the image includes the same text as this post. Black Lives Matter 5280 logo at the bottom.]

items.title: We want to boost this post to raise awareness about what is...
items.content_html:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

We want to boost this post to raise awareness about what is happening in the Tigray region of Ethiopia. For more information on current actions, please keep an eye on the Black Lives Matter 5280 facebook page.

Millete Birhanemaskel

Want to do something great today? Tweet #TigrayGenocide Day 60. (I'm @gualjeganu)

The Ethiopian government is angry, calling us "bots" and an "organized campaign." They underestimate our love for Tigray. We will not stop until we reach our families!!!

#TigrayGenocide Day 60

items.title: Sanctuary4All is continuing their amazing Solidarity Meals in...
items.content_html:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Sanctuary4All is continuing their amazing Solidarity Meals in the new year! See below for more info on the program and for the schedule. They’ll be selling gorditas, pupusas, sandwiches, chile relleno, pozole, burritos, & more this month. Orders for gorditas next week are open at https://solidaritymeals.paperform.co

"Sanctuary4All created this program for solidarity meals based on the pandemic many immigrant families are now unemployed and are fighting their deportation proce...sses and need to keep paying legal fees. Both Saturday’s at the middle of the month different families have been raising funds for themselves to be able to survive and pay legal fees now that neither can receive federal benefits. Help us and the families to survive during this hard time, they like to work for their resources and are happy in showing with this program their culture now that every week food from different countries is sold while connecting with the community to create relationships of support and solidarity between community and organizations." (from Sanctuary4All)

See MoreSanctuary4All Colorado is in Denver, Colorado.

The Solidarity Meals schedule is up for the new year! We’ll be selling gorditas, pupusas, sandwiches, chile relleno, pozole, burritos, & more this month. Orders for gorditas next week are open at https://solidaritymeals.paperform.co

items.title: CW: graphic descriptions of violence in linked article. We want...
items.content_html:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

CW: graphic descriptions of violence in linked article.

We want to highlight what is happening right now in the Tigray region of Ethiopia. The article tells the often-invisible story of many people living in our community who are worried about their missing family and friends.

If you don't already, make sure to follow Black Lives Matter 5280 to learn more about actions and efforts to support our neighbors and impacted people in and around the Tigray region. We will continue to share here as we learn of ways to support locally or in the region directly.

100% of proceeds go to support needs of immigrant families. Help Jeanette raise the $ she needs to keep fighting!

Sanctuary4All Colorado is in Denver, Colorado.

Miss out on tamales from Yessenia? Jeanette is selling them for pickup at 5:00pm on December 23, just in time for Christmas. You can order at https://ChristmasTamales.paperform.co. Does your family make tamales for Nochebuena o Navidad? Let us know in the comments!

White folks who are taking to the streets in solidarity, are your actions and decisions centering Black, Indigenous, and People of Color? This document provides guidance on how to prioritize the vision of BIPOC organizers, tips for keeping safe during actions, and direction for white accomplices acting in a security/marshal role. This document also includes BIPOC led organizations doing amazing work in Colorado.
